title: Dishing the dirt on airlines
text:
Dishing the dirt on airlines 24 Sep 2015 at 03:47 142 viewed 0 comments NEWSPAPER SECTION: LIFE | WRITER: KARNJANA KARNJANATAWE - + Airline tray tables top the list of the dirtiest places on aeroplanes and at airports, according to research from Travelmath.com. 
The online trip calculator sent a microbiologist to collect 26 samples from five airports and four flights. The samples were sent to a lab to estimate the total bacteria population per square inch. 
Tray tables were found to have almost 10 times the bacteria of lavatory flush buttons. 
The tray table by average has 2,155 germ colony-forming units per square inch (CFU/sq.in), followed by drinking fountain buttons (1,240 CFU/sq.in), overhead air vents (285 CFU/sq.in), lavatory flush buttons (265 CFU/sq.in), seat belt buckles (230 CFU/sq.in) and bathroom stall locks (70 CFU/sq.in). 
Comparing that with household items, the United States' National Science Foundation found home toilet seats carry 172 CFU/sq.in while mobile phone surfaces have 27 CFU/sq.in and a banknote carries about 5 CFU/sq.in. 
Fortunately, all 26 samples from the aeroplanes and airports were free from decal coliforms such as E.coli. 
The research demonstrates the need for tray tables to be cleaned between flights, and not only at the end of the day, stated the study. 
It also suggested airlines increase efficiency of boarding and deplaning to give cabin crew more time to do a thorough cleaning between flights. Visit www.travelmath.com/feature/airline-hygiene-exposed . Investment in yacht show 
The Transport Ministry will invest 15 million baht to host the Phuket Yacht Show in February. 
The purpose is to promote Thailand as the marina hub of the Asean area, according to Transport Deputy Minister Ormsin Chivapruck. The ministry expects the event will be the largest showcase of international sailing boats with 150 yachts and more than 10 luxury superyachts, which are popular among travellers in the Mediterranean. 
The event will be organised from Feb 8-14. It was planned to run for two months in November and December this year. The postponement will help extend the time for preparation and promoting the event at an international level, he said. 
"People who travel with their yachts are one of the prime targets for the tourism industry because they are high spenders," he said. 
The Phuket Yacht Show is expected to attract 3,000 visitors. 
The ministry also plans to revise rules and regulations to allow those who travel by yacht to the Kingdom to be able to stay longer or they can register their yachts for a renting service in the future. Visit www.phuketyachtshow.com . Streets of good, clean food 
The Ministry of Public Health and the Ministry of Tourism and Sports have launched the 2015 Discover Thainess Streets and Markets of Clean Food Good Taste project. 
The aim is to promote food safety for tourists. Those who are qualified will receive the "Clean Food Good Taste" logo and the "Clean Fresh Market" certification. 
The Clean Food Good Taste project was initiated by the Ministry of Public Health in 1999. A total of 125,987 restaurants and food vendors across the country, excluding Bangkok, are certified while a total of 1,351 fresh markets have been certified under the Clean Fresh Market project, which was launched in 2003. 
Under the new campaign of the 2015 Discover Thainess Streets and Markets of Clean Food Good Taste, the focus will be on the "12 Not To Be Missed Provinces", which is the year-long campaign of the Tourism and Sports Ministry. The targeted provinces are Lampang, Phetchabun, Nan, Buri Ram, Loei, Samut Songkhram, Ratchaburi, Trat, Chanthaburi, Trang, Chumphon and Nakhon Si Thammarat. 
According to Public Health Minister Piyasakol Sakolsatayadorn, provincial health offices and the provincial administration offices of the 12 provinces will organise seminars for local restaurants and food vendors about the Clean Food Good Taste concept. 
To be certified, street food vendors and restaurants must not provide alcoholic drinks or cigarettes. They must not use foam containers, must provide serving spoons and have clean restrooms and wash basins. Hotels update The Dream Phuket Hotel & Spa will open in Phuket in December. 
The hotel will feature 174 guestrooms including suites and villas, a restaurant, bar, lounge and swimming pool. It will be located at the Laguna Phuket on the west coast of the island. 
The property in Phuket will be managed by Singapore's Castlewood Group which has partnered with DÃ©but Hotel Group, the Dream hotel brand owner. 
Dream Phuket will be the second property after Dream Bangkok located on Soi Sukhumvit 15. Visit www.dreamhotels.com/phuket . Anantara Vacation Club will open in Chiang Mai early next year. 
The property will be operated under a shared ownership concept allowing each club owner to stay in 4,000 hotels worldwide. The resort will also welcome non-members and walk-in guests. 
Located on Charoen Prathet Road, the resort will offer 44 suites with options of one, two and three bedrooms. All suites will have living areas with floor-to-ceiling windows and en suite bathrooms, fully-equipped kitchens and dining areas. Also provided is a rooftop swimming pool.
